notes_translated.fr: En 2006, 49,4 % des hommes et 46,5 % des femmes de 15 ans et plus étaient légalement mariés (et non séparés), tandis que 2,7 % des hommes et 3,2 % des femmes étaient séparés, mais toujours légalement mariés. Dans le cas des personnes divorcées, les proportions d’hommes et de femmes étaient respectivement de 7,2 % et de 8,8 %. Chez les personnes veuves et les personnes jamais mariées, les écarts entre les sexes étaient plus grands : 2,5 % des hommes et 9,7 % des femmes étaient veufs, tandis que 38,2 % des hommes, mais seulement 31,8 % des femmes n’avaient jamais été légalement mariés. Dans le cas des personnes âgées de 15 ans et plus et jamais mariées, on trouvait les plus fortes proportions au Québec (46,8 % des hommes et 40,0 % des femmes) et dans les trois territoires (au Yukon : 46,6 % des hommes et 40,7 % des femmes; dans les Territoires du Nord-Ouest : 54,4 % des hommes et 49,4 % des femmes; au Nunavut : 63,4 % des hommes et 59,2 % des femmes). D’autre part, l’écart entre les taux d’hommes et de femmes jamais légalement mariés était le plus élevé en Alberta (37,7 % des hommes contre 30,4 % des femmes, soit un écart de 7,3 %) et en Saskatchewan (36,6 % des hommes contre 29,3 % des femmes, soit un écart de 7,3 %). Chez les personnes veuves, la différence était la plus marquée en Saskatchewan (2,7 % de veufs contre 11,6 % de veuves, soit un écart de près de 9 %). La carte montre, par division de recensement, l’état matrimonial de la population âgée de 15 ans et plus selon le sexe.
notes_translated.en: In 2006, 49.4% of males and 46.5% of females aged 15 years and over were legally married (and not separated), while 2.7% of the males and 3.2% of the females were separated, but still legally married. The male and female proportions for divorced people were 7.2% and 8.8% respectively. The gender gaps in the widowed and never married categories were larger: 2.5% of males and 9.7% of females were widowed while 38.2% of males, but only 31.8% of females were never legally married. In the case of the never married population 15 years of age and over, the highest proportions occurred in Quebec (46.8% of men and 40.0% of women), and the three territories (Yukon: 46.6% of men and 40.7% of women; Northwest Territories: 54.4% of men and 49.4% of women; and Nunavut: 63.4% of men and 59.2% of women). On the other hand, the sexual divergence of rates between males and females never legally married was highest in Alberta (37.7% of males versus 30.4% for females or a 7.3% difference) and Saskatchewan (36.6% of males versus 29.3% for females or a 7.3% spread). For the widowed population, this disparity was most pronounced for Saskatchewan (2.7% widowers versus 11.6% widows or an almost 9% difference). The map shows by census division the marital status of the population 15 years of age and over by gender.

subject: society_and_culture

The male and female proportions for divorced people were 7.2% and 8.8% respectively. The gender gaps in the widowed and never married categories were larger: 2.5% of males and 9.7% of females were widowed while 38.2% of males, but only 31.8% of females were never legally married. In the case of the never married population 15 years of age and over, the highest proportions occurred in Quebec (46.8% of men and 40.0% of women), and the three territories (Yukon: 46.6% of men and 40.7% of women; Northwest Territories: 54.4% of men and 49.4% of women; and Nunavut: 63.4% of men and 59.2% of women). On the other hand, the sexual divergence of rates between males and females never legally married was highest in Alberta (37.7% of males versus 30.4% for females or a 7.3% difference) and Saskatchewan (36.6% of males versus 29.3% for females or a 7.3% spread). For the widowed population, this disparity was most pronounced for Saskatchewan (2.7% widowers versus 11.6% widows or an almost 9% difference).
